name: Plastic Bottles
instructions: Rinse and remove caps before recycling.
details: Recycle #1 and #2 plastics only. Avoid soft plastics like plastic bags.

name: Cardboard
instructions: Flatten boxes. Remove any tape or labels.
details: Keep cardboard clean and dry. Greasy boxes belong in compost or trash.

name: Aluminum Cans
instructions: Rinse to remove residue before placing in the bin.
details: Aluminum is 100% recyclable. Crushed cans save space.

name: Glass Bottles
details: Do not include mirrors or broken glass. Check your local program.

name: Newspapers
details: Bundle with string if required. Avoid mixing with magazines.

name: Steel Food Cans
instructions: Rinse cans. Labels may stay on.
details: Flatten if possible. Recycle with metals.

name: Magazines
instructions: Keep dry. Do not include plastic-wrapped issues.

name: Milk Jugs
details: Usually HDPE plastic. Recycle separately from caps.

name: Junk Mail
instructions: Remove plastic windows and glossy ads.
details: Most plain paper can be recycled.

name: Tin Foil
instructions: Clean thoroughly and ball it up.

name: Egg Cartons
instructions: Recycle paper-based cartons. Foam ones go to trash.

name: Glass Jars
instructions: Rinse and remove food residue. Labels okay.
details: Check color-sorting rules in your area.

name: Cereal Boxes
instructions: Remove plastic liner and flatten box.
details: Clean, dry paperboard is easy to recycle.
